raw_text:
Safin relieved at Aussie recovery
 
 Marat Safin admitted he thought he was suffering another Australian Open final nightmare when he lost the opening set to Lleyton Hewitt.
 
 The Russian, who lost the 2002 and 2004 finals, fought back brilliantly to win 1-6 6-3 6-4 6-4. "I was nervous and I couldn't play tennis," said Safin. "He started really well. He wasn't as nervous as I was because I was thinking of the two finals that I played and wasn't successful." He added: "You really have to deal with the pressure because normally it never happens but when you come to the final you are so tight because you want to win. "I tried to play some tennis but I couldn't. He has huge experience, he's won two Grand Slam titles, he's won 24 titles, he's a great player and he deals with pressure."
 
 From 4-1 down in the third set, Safin played some of his best tennis to reel off seven games and take control of the match. "In the third set, just all of a sudden, it all turn around completely in a way I couldn't expect," said Safin. "Because he made a couple of mistakes, I was a little bit lucky at some point, then the confidence came back and I was back in the game." And the Russian revealed that the victory, and his semi-final win over world number one Roger Federer, had given him a massive boost for the future. "You get huge confidence because Roger is a great player," said Safin. "Once I beat him, and then Lleyton, it's like you get so much confidence in yourself that you really can play great. "You can win big titles and you can beat huge players in the finals and semi-finals."
llama3.2:1b: Marat Safin lost the opening set to Lleyton Hewitt at the Australian Open, but fought back to win 1-6 6-3 6-4 6-4.
llama3.2:3b: Marat Safin recovered from a set loss to Lleyton Hewitt at the Australian Open, winning 1-6 6-3 6-4 6-4. Safin attributed his initial nervousness to pressure from past tournament losses, but gained confidence after beating Roger Federer in the semi-finals and later Hewitt, stating he now feels capable of playing great tennis and competing for big titles.
gemma2:2b: Marat Safin won the Australian Open final against Lleyton Hewitt after losing the first set. He admitted to feeling pressure and was reminded of his previous final losses. Safin overcame a deficit in the third set and defeated Lleyton Hewitt with incredible performance.  This victory gave him significant confidence for future matches.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Safin returned to Australia after a break, winning 6-4 6-3 6-4 with a great start but then struggled against Lleyton Hewitt. He showed his skills on clay court but lost more easily than expected. His coach praised him for not giving up and saying that being nervous helped him perform better. Safin's success boosted his confidence to go on to win the Australian Open, where he defeated world No.1 Roger Federer in the semi-finals.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Safin overcame a 1-6 deficit to defeat Hewitt at the Australian Open, citing pressure as his primary issue. After losing the first set, Safin showed improved form by winning three sets with some exceptional backhand play. The victory boosted his confidence for future Grand Slams, noting that beating Federer and Hewitt gave him significant motivation and increased his ability to win against top players.
qwen2.5:3b: Marat Safin relieved after recovering from a tough opening set loss to Lleyton Hewitt at the Australian Open. Despite being nervous, he fought back convincingly, winning 6-1 3-6 6-4 6-4. Safin attributes his eventual success partly due to some lucky breaks and increased confidence following his semi-final victories over Roger Federer and the finals of 2002 and 2004. The wins have given him significant self-confidence, boosting his chances for future success in major tournaments.

smollm:1.7b:
Safin relieved at Aussie recovery after losing to Lleyton Hewitt in the opening set of the 2004 Australian Open, admitting that he thought he was suffering another Australian Open final nightmare. He fought back brilliantly to win 1-6 6-3 6-4 6-4, winning his second match at the Australian Open and becoming the first Russian player to win a Grand Slam title in 2004.

Safin had previously won two Grand Slam titles (at the 2002 and 2004 Australian Open) and was known for his intense focus and mental preparation before big matches. In the third set, he played some of his best tennis to reel off seven games and take control of the match, winning 6-3 6-7 6-5 6-7 6-7 6-7 6-7 6-7 6-7 6-7.

Safin revealed that in the third set, he was a little bit lucky because he made some mistakes and then his confidence came back, allowing him to win the match. He also revealed that winning the Australian Open had given him a huge boost for the future, saying that he got so much confidence in himself that he could play great tennis.

Safin's victory over Lleyton Hewitt was a major moment in his career and marked a significant improvement in his mental preparation before big matches. He said that winning the Australian Open had given him a sense of pride and accomplishment, saying that it was one of the best moments of his life.
